title: Switch brand palette from purple/blue to green across light and dark themes

requirements.summary: Replace purple/blue theme tokens and any hardcoded purple/blue utility colors with a green-based palette for both light and dark modes while preserving contrast/readability.
acceptanceCriteria: In light mode, primary actions and accents (e.g., buttons, icons using `text-primary`, focus rings using `ring-ring`) appear green-toned rather than purple/blue.
In dark mode, the primary color and focus ring are also green-toned and remain clearly visible on dark backgrounds.
The `.gradient-text` utility no longer gradients to a blue color (e.g., no longer uses `to-blue-600`) and instead uses a green-compatible gradient end color.

No obvious purple/blue brand accents remain in common UI surfaces (header icon background, primary buttons, links/accents, focus styles) unless intentionally kept for non-brand semantic purposes (e.g., destructive/red).
Typography and contrast remain readable in both themes (no low-contrast green text on green backgrounds).

file_operations.description: Update the HSL design token CSS variables for light and dark mode (notably `--primary`, `--ring`, and related accent/chart tokens currently using purple/blue hues) to a cohesive green-based palette with good contrast, and update the `.gradient-text` utility to remove `to-blue-600` in favor of a green-compatible gradient end color. Use shadcn-ui theming via CSS variables (tokens consumed by Tailwind color mappings) rather than editing any files under `frontend/src/components/ui`. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
